My setup is complete. I will provide my first command in the next turn.

I'm trying to repurpose *only* the homepage of my previous portfolio into this new project (the dir we're on). I've placed the previous portfolio in this directory as well (in the directory `./main`). We did some work previously; you've copied the assets and some relevant codes. You've also tried to configure tailwind into the current project (that's using UnoCSS, perhaps as a plugin). Here's the plan you had before (although we've moved a bit after this plan). Please make sure where we're at right now and let's start working <3 Plan: "That's a lot of errors, but it's expected when merging code from two different
   projects. The good news is that most of these are TypeScript errors related
  to missing files or incorrect paths, which are fixable.

  Here's the plan:

   1. Fix Path Aliases: The errors show that the @/ alias is not resolving
      correctly for many files. I'll fix this in the tsconfig.json file.
   2. Copy Missing UI Components: The bento components depend on a set of UI
      components (like Skeleton, Card, etc.) that are missing. I'll copy these
      from your old project's main/src/components/ui directory.
   3. Copy Utility Files: There are also missing utility functions (like in
      @/lib/utils). I'll copy those over as well.
   4. Adapt to New Content Schema: The way blog posts are structured in the new
      project is different. I'll update the BentoGrid.astro component to fetch
      and handle posts using the new schema. This will fix the errors related to
      date and hidden properties.
   5. Address Remaining TypeScript Errors: I'll work through any remaining
      TypeScript errors one by one.

  I'll start by reading the tsconfig.json from both the old and new projects
  to sort out the path aliases."

Okay, I'm ready. It looks like we're migrating your old portfolio's homepage. I'll start by assessing our current progress against the plan, beginning with the `tsconfig.json` to check the path aliases.
`tsconfig.json` alias is correct. Now, I'll check `src/components` and `src/lib` for the old project's files.

parts.text: Before we continue, we're not just moving the old homepage. I'd like to specifically repurpose the bento sections onto the current homepage, right under the intro section (under the profile picture, name, and links).

Okay, I'm integrating the old bento grid into the new homepage. First, I'll verify all UI components are in `src/components/ui` by comparing with `main/src/components/ui`. Then, I'll copy the bento grid components to `src/components/bento`, adapt `BentoGrid.astro` by analyzing its dependencies and data fetching, and integrate it into `src/pages/index.astro`. I'll also adjust for the new content schema and fix any broken styles, likely by merging Tailwind CSS with UnoCSS. I'll begin by listing the contents of `main/src/components/ui`.

parts.text: Right, `skeleton.tsx` is done. Now to create the remaining UI components. I'll read `chart.tsx`, `dropdown-menu.tsx`, `mobile-menu.tsx`, `pagination.tsx`, `scroll-area.tsx`, and `separator.tsx` in parallel, then write them to the new project.

response.output:
import * as React from 'react'
import * as ScrollAreaPrimitive from '@radix-ui/react-scroll-area'

import { cn } from '@/lib/utils'

const ScrollArea = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
>(({ className, children, ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root
    ref={ref}
    className={cn('relative overflow-hidden', className)}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport className="h-full w-full rounded-[inherit]">
      {children}
    </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Viewport>
    <ScrollBar />
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.Corner />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root>
))
ScrollArea.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.Root.displayName

const ScrollBar = React.forwardRef<
  React.ElementRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>,
  React.ComponentPropsWithoutRef<typeof ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
>(({ className, orientation = 'vertical', ...props }, ref) => (
  <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar
    ref={ref}
    orientation={orientation}
    className={cn(
      'flex touch-none select-none transition-colors',
      orientation === 'vertical' &&
        'h-full w-2.5 border-l border-l-transparent p-[1px]',
      orientation === 'horizontal' &&
        'h-2.5 flex-col border-t border-t-transparent p-[1px]',
      className,
    )}
    {...props}
  >
    <ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaThumb className="relative flex-1 rounded-full bg-border" />
  </ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar>
))
ScrollBar.displayName = ScrollAreaPrimitive.ScrollAreaScrollbar.displayName

export { ScrollArea, ScrollBar }
